newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Campbell sees A$5 mln first half profit.
newsitem.headline: Campbell sees A$5 mln first half profit.

text.p: Consumer products manufacturer Campbell Brothers Ltd said on Monday that it expected to achieve a net profit of about A$5 million in the first six months of 1997/98 (April/March) from A$3.1 million a year ago.
Chairman Rodney White said the expected first half result would also represent a rise on the A$4.4 million achieved in the second six months to March 31 this year.
"Such a result at this early stage of consolidating benefits of recent expansion is both satisfying and rewarding," White said at the annual general meeting.
He said the company had growth plans beyond the current year, but did not elaborate.
Campbell Brothers achieved a net profit of A$7.4 million in the 1996/97 year.
